intro: Piptostigma glabrescens var. lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceolate piptostigma, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stems. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, often blooming during the cooler months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. The species is noted for its resilience to drought and its ability to grow in rocky or sandy habitats.
